left: This map shows housing characteristics by census tract in the Mid-Ohio Regional Planning Commission (MORPC) planning area. This is an interactive map, which means when clicking on the map, the information will be presented by popup.

Housing data are from the US Census Bureau.

left:
BIKE GREENWAYS

Bike greenways are dedicated paths for fitness activites.

BIKE TRAIL HEADS

Trail heads allow access to greenways. Most have parking and park facilities at them.

ROUTES BY LEVEL OF COMFORT

These are streets rated by the level of comfort of bicycle riders
right:
BIKE DATA

Trail and Street data come from MORPC.

left: This map displays NPDES permit holders in Ohio. The National Pollution Discharge Elimination System (NPDES) is a pollution regulation system to decrease point water pollution sources.

left:
This is a map of the trees maintained by the City of Columbus.. This database has the locations along with various characteristics of the trees like condition, age, etc. Try changing the basemap to imagery or topographic at tighter zoom to see exactly where the largest trees are.

TREES

Circles represent trees that are in the City of Columbus tree management system. The size of the circle represents the diameter of the trunk at 4.5 feet from the ground also known as diameter at breast height (DBH). Larger trees are shaded orange to make them stand out.
right:
TREE DATA

Columbus Tree Data courtesy of the City of Columbus. Download the tree data at the City of Columbus open data site.

left: This map layer shows parking meters in the City of Columbus. Information provided about each meter includes its operational status, in-service hours, maximum time, hourly-rate, and handicap accessibility.
right:
PARKING METERS DATA

Columbus parking meters Data courtesy of the City of Columbus.

left: This map layer shows industrial facilities in the City of Columbus. This layer is maintained through a cooperative effort by multiple departments of the City of Columbus using first-hand knowledge of the area as well as a variety of authoritative data sources. While significant effort is made to ensure the data is as accurate and comprehensive as possible, some points of interest may be excluded and included points may not be immediately updated as change occurs.
right:
INDUSTRY DATA

Columbus Industry Facilities Data courtesy of the City of Columbus.

left: This map layer shows office facilities in the City of Columbus. Corporate and non-profit offices are included. This layer is maintained through a cooperative effort by multiple departments of the City of Columbus using first-hand knowledge of the area as well as a variety of authoritative data sources. While significant effort is made to ensure the data is as accurate and comprehensive as possible, some points of interest may be excluded and included points may not be immediately updated as change occurs.
right:
MEDICAL FACILITIES DATA

Columbus Medical Facilities Data courtesy of the City of Columbus.

left: This map layer shows facilities related to emergency response in the City of Columbus. Police and fire stations, as well as other facilities, are included. This layer is maintained through a cooperative effort by multiple departments of the City of Columbus using first-hand knowledge of the area as well as a variety of authoritative data sources. While significant effort is made to ensure the data is as accurate and comprehensive as possible, some points of interest may be excluded and included points may not be immediately updated as change occurs.
right:
EMERGENCY FACILITIES DATA

Columbus Emergency Facilities Data courtesy of the City of Columbus.

left:
The City of Columbus Service Center provides a way for the resident to submit a request for City Services. The Service Center is the single point of contact for requesting all non-emergency City services and is available to residents, City businesses, and visitors.


The Columbus Service Center is also known as "3-1-1"; its mission is to provide access to City services and City information with the highest possible levels of customer service. The "3-1-1" initiative strives to help City agencies provide efficient service delivery by allowing them to focus on their core missions, manage workloads efficiently, provide insight into the needs of residents, and measure how well services are delivered.
right: City of Columbus 311 Requests - Last 7 Days.
